trans-unit.source: Provides access to the HTTP response in order to access and respond to the additional information made available for requests over the HTTP protocol.
This is a general-purpose class that gives you direct access to the HTTP response information, which could be used for encapsulation of HTTP-specific information.
One use of this class is to support services implemented in accordance with the Representational State Transfer (REST) architecture.
This class enables you to support the following scenarios:
Controls whether an entity body is transmitted.
Allows HTTP header (key, value) pairs to be set for each response.
Varies the status code and status description used for each response.
This class can be used by <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.HttpTransportBindingElement> and related classes.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.HttpResponseMessageProperty"></xref> class.
This constructor initializes the object as follows:
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.HttpResponseMessageProperty.StatusCode%2A> = <xref:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.OK>.
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.HttpResponseMessageProperty.StatusDescription%2A> is set to `null`.
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.HttpResponseMessageProperty.SuppressEntityBody%2A> = `false`.
Gets the HTTP headers from the HTTP response.
Returns a <xref href="System.Net.WebHeaderCollection"></xref> that contains the HTTP headers in the HTTP response.
Gets the name of the message property associated with the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.HttpResponseMessageProperty"></xref> class.
Returns "httpResponse".
Gets or sets the status code of the current HTTP response to which this property is attached.
This property has one of the values in the <xref:System.Net.HttpStatusCode> enumeration.
Returns the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.HttpResponseMessageProperty.StatusCode"></xref> to send on the HTTP response.
The value is set to less than 100 or greater than 599.
Gets or sets the description of the status code of the current HTTP response to which this property is attached.
This property provides a user-friendly description of the returned status code.
Returns the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.HttpResponseMessageProperty.StatusDescription"></xref> to send for the HTTP response.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the body of the message is ignored and an empty message is sent.

This property is used for empty message responses, for example, a service that accepts a POST request and returns a response that contains no message body with StatusCode = 200 and StatusDescription = OK.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.HttpResponseMessageProperty> associated with this response has this property set to `true`.
`true` if the message body is suppressed; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets whether the message preamble is suppressed.

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.HttpResponseMessageProperty.SuppressPreamble%2A> property enables users to write content into the <xref:System.Web.HttpResponseBase.OutputStream%2A> from within a [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] operation body.
This takes effect only on webhosted scenarios.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.HttpResponseMessageProperty.SuppressPreamble%2A> property is `false` by default.

If the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.HttpResponseMessageProperty.SuppressPreamble%2A> property is set to `true`, you must set the headers, content-type, status code on the response because WCF will no longer do it.
The following code shows an example of how to do this.
`true` if the message preamble is suppressed; otherwise, `false`.
Creates a new copy of the current instance.
A newly created copy of type <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.IMessageProperty"></xref> of the current instance.
